page.title: 03Esholt..Introduction 2
page.content: The village of Esholt was not mentioned in the original Domesday Book because of an accident.It seems that William the Conqueror's clerks, having visited both Esholt and nearby Hawksworth,became confused when later they wrote up their findings and referred to them both as Hawksworth. In 1940 the vicar speculated in the Parish Magazine on the origin of the name of the village.He wrote:-If Mr Hitler could have seen it-which God forbid-he would have called it an{ {Esche}tree.That is the German name for it.That name came to England with the Saxons,but it came to be changed to{ {ash}in time...{Holt}is the German name for a wood.And so we get our village name.{Esholt}probably comes from {Escheholt} a wood of ash trees.
